Package renderer.scene.primitives

Class Triangle

java.lang.Object
renderer.scene.primitives.Primitive
renderer.scene.primitives.OrientablePrimitive
renderer.scene.primitives.Triangle
public class Triangle extends OrientablePrimitive
A Triangle object has two lists of three integers each. One list represents the three corners of the triangle in space. The integers are indices into the Vertex list of a Model object. The other list holds integer indices into the Color list of that Model object.

Since a Triangle is made of three points, and three points determine a plane, a Triangle is always "flat".

A Triangle is also always "convex".

The combination of flat and convex means that we can give a Triangle an orientation and we can determine if the Triangle if "front facing" or "back facing".

  • Constructor Details

    • Triangle

      public Triangle(int i0, int i1, int i2)
      Construct a Triangle object using three integer indices. Use the given indices for both the Vertex list and the front and back Color lists.
      Parameters:
      i0 - index for 1st Vertex of the new Triangle
      i1 - index for 2nd Vertex of the new Triangle
      i2 - index for 3rd Vertex of the new Triangle

    • Triangle

      public Triangle(int i0, int i1, int i2, int c)
      Construct a Triangle object using three integer indices for the Vertex list and one integer index for the Color list. Make the back face color the same as the front face color.
      Parameters:
      i0 - index of 1st Vertex of the new Triangle
      i1 - index of 2nd Vertex of the new Triangle
      i2 - index of 3rd Vertex of the new Triangle
      c - index of the Color of the new Triangle

    • Triangle

      public Triangle(int i0, int i1, int i2, int c0, int c1, int c2)
      Construct a Triangle object using three integer indices for the Vertex list and three integer indices for the Color list. Make the back face colors the same as the front face colors.

      NOTE: This constructor does not put any Vertex or Color objects into this Triangle's Model object. This constructor assumes that the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this Triangle gets rendered).

      Parameters:
      i0 - index of 1st Vertex of the new Triangle
      i1 - index of 2nd Vertex of the new Triangle
      i2 - index of 3rd Vertex of the new Triangle
      c0 - index of 1st Color of the new Triangle
      c1 - index of 2nd Color of the new Triangle
      c2 - index of 3rd Color of the new Triangle

    • Triangle

      public Triangle(int i0, int i1, int i2, int c0, int c1, int c2, int c3, int c4, int c5)
      Construct a Triangle object using three integer indices for the Vertex list, three integer indices for the front face Color list, and three indices for the back face Color list.

      NOTE: This constructor does not put any Vertex or Color objects into this Triangle's Model object. This constructor assumes that the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this Triangle gets rendered).

      Parameters:
      i0 - index of 1st Vertex of the new Triangle
      i1 - index of 2nd Vertex of the new Triangle
      i2 - index of 3rd Vertex of the new Triangle
      c0 - index of 1st Color of the new Triangle
      c1 - index of 2nd Color of the new Triangle
      c2 - index of 3rd Color of the new Triangle
      c3 - index of 1st backface Color of the new Triangle
      c4 - index of 2nd backface Color of the new Triangle
      c5 - index of 3rd backface Color of the new Triangle

    • Triangle

      public Triangle(int i0, int i1, int i2, int tc0, int tc1, int tc2, int textureIndex)
      Construct a Triangle object using three integer indices for the Vertex list and three indices for the TexCoord list.

      NOTE: This constructor does not put any Vertex or TexCoord objects into this Triangle's Model object. This constructor assumes that the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this Triangle gets rendered).

      Parameters:
      i0 - index of 1st Vertex of the new Triangle
      i1 - index of 2nd Vertex of the new Triangle
      i2 - index of 3rd Vertex of the new Triangle
      tc0 - index of 1st TexCoord of the new Triangle
      tc1 - index of 2nd TexCoord of the new Triangle
      tc2 - index of 3rd TexCoord of the new Triangle
      textureIndex - integer index into a Texture list

    • Triangle

      public Triangle(int i0, int i1, int i2, int c0, int c1, int c2, int tc0, int tc1, int tc2, int textureIndex)
      Construct a Triangle object using three integer indices for the Vertex list, three integer indices for the front face Color list, and three indices for the TexCoord list.

      NOTE: This constructor does not put any Vertex or Color or TexCoord objects into this Triangle's Model object. This constructor assumes that the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this Triangle gets rendered).

      Parameters:
      i0 - index of 1st Vertex of the new Triangle
      i1 - index of 2nd Vertex of the new Triangle
      i2 - index of 3rd Vertex of the new Triangle
      c0 - index of 1st Color of the new Triangle
      c1 - index of 2nd Color of the new Triangle
      c2 - index of 3rd Color of the new Triangle
      tc0 - index of 1st TexCoord of the new Triangle
      tc1 - index of 2nd TexCoord of the new Triangle
      tc2 - index of 3rd TexCoord of the new Triangle
      textureIndex - integer index into a Texture list

      public Triangle(int i0, int i1, int i2, int c0, int c1, int c2, int c3, int c4, int c5, int tc0, int tc1, int tc2, int textureIndex)

      NOTE: This constructor does not put any Vertex or Color or TexCoord objects into this Triangle's Model object. This constructor assumes that the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this Triangle gets rendered).

      tc2 - index of 3rd TexCoord of the new Triangle
      textureIndex - integer index into a Texture list

    • Triangle

      public Triangle(List<Integer> vIndexList, List<Integer> cIndexList)
      Construct a Triangle object using the two given Lists of integer indices. Make the back face colors the same as the front face colors.

      NOTE: This constructor does not put any Vertex or Color objects into this Primitive's Model object. This constructor assumes that the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this Primitive gets rendered).

      Parameters:
      vIndexList - List of integer indices into a Vertex list
      cIndexList - List of integer indices into a Color list
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if vIndexList is null
      NullPointerException - if cIndexList is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if the size of vIndexList or cIndexList is not 3

    • Triangle

      public Triangle(List<Integer> vIndexList, List<Integer> cIndexList, List<Integer> cIndexList2)
      Construct a Triangle object using the three given Lists of integer indices.

      NOTE: This constructor does not put any Vertex or Color objects into this Primitive's Model object. This constructor assumes that the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this Primitive gets rendered).

      Parameters:
      vIndexList - List of integer indices into a Vertex list
      cIndexList - List of integer indices into a Color list
      cIndexList2 - List of integer indices into a Color list
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if vIndexList is null
      NullPointerException - if cIndexList is null
      NullPointerException - if cIndexList2 is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if the size of any one of the index lists is not 3

    • Triangle

      public Triangle(List<Integer> vIndexList, List<Integer> cIndexList, List<Integer> cIndexList2, List<Integer> tcIndexList, int textureIndex)
      Construct a Triangle object using the four given Lists of integer indices.

      NOTE: This constructor does not put any Vertex or Color objects into this Primitive's Model object. This constructor assumes that the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this Primitive gets rendered).

      Parameters:
      vIndexList - List of integer indices into a Vertex list
      cIndexList - List of integer indices into a Color list
      cIndexList2 - List of integer indices into a Color list
      tcIndexList - List of integer indices into a java.awt.TexCoord list
      textureIndex - integer index into a Texture list
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if vIndexList is null
      NullPointerException - if cIndexList is null
      NullPointerException - if cIndexList2 is null
      NullPointerException - if tcIndexList2 is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if the size of any one of the index lists is not 3
